questions.instructions:
Questions 1 – 7

Write TRUE, FALSE or NOT GIVEN.
questions.question: 1. There are more available copies of the Bill Benjamin album than the Gerome and the Jives album.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: FALSE. In the IELTS test, you should always take a guess as there's no penalty for wrong answers.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. The passage contradicts this statement.
Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. Please review the passage carefully.
Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. The passage clearly states the opposite.

questions.instructions:
Questions 8 – 10

Choose the correct letter A, B, C, or D.
questions.question: 8. What is the annual cost of family membership at Brightwood Leisure Centre?
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is C (£450 annually).

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. That is the student membership price. The correct answer is C (£450 annually).
Incorrect. That is the full membership price. The correct answer is C (£450 annually).
Correct! Family membership costs £450 annually for up to four household members.
Incorrect. The correct answer is C (£450 annually).

questions.options:
A: £120 per year
B: £280 per year
C: £450 annually
D: £600 per year

questions.question: 9. What type of swimwear is NOT acceptable in the pool area?
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is B (shorts and t-shirts).

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. Swimming caps are recommended but not mandatory. The correct answer is B.
Correct! The passage states that shorts and t-shirts are not acceptable in the pool area.
Incorrect. One-piece swimsuits are appropriate swimwear. The correct answer is B.
Incorrect. Swim trunks are appropriate swimwear. The correct answer is B.

questions.options:
A: Swimming caps
B: Shorts and t-shirts
C: One-piece swimsuits
D: Swim trunks

questions.question: 10. When does Brightwood Leisure Centre operate on weekends?
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is C (8:00 AM to 6:00 PM).

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. Those are the weekday hours. The correct answer is C.
Incorrect. The correct answer is C (8:00 AM to 6:00 PM).
Correct! The centre operates from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM on weekends.
Incorrect. The correct answer is C (8:00 AM to 6:00 PM).

questions.options:
A: 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM
B: 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM
C: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM
D: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM

questions.instructions:
Questions 11 – 14

Complete each sentence with the correct ending, A, B, C, or D.
questions.question: 11. Members can bring guests to the centre provided that
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is A (the guests are accompanied by the member at all times).

mc_options.text: A: the guests are accompanied by the member at all times
mc_options.feedback: Correct! The passage states that guests must be accompanied by their sponsoring member at all times.

mc_options.text: B: the guests have their own membership card
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. Guest passes are free and valid for one visit only. The correct answer is A.

mc_options.text: C: the guests pay an additional fee
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. Guest passes are free. The correct answer is A.

mc_options.text: D: the guests attend during off-peak hours
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. No such restriction is mentioned. The correct answer is A.

questions.options:
A: the guests are accompanied by the member at all times
B: the guests have their own membership card
C: the guests pay an additional fee
D: the guests attend during off-peak hours

questions.question: 12. Frequent guests who visit more than six times per year are
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is B (encouraged to become members).

mc_options.text: A: required to pay a visitor fee
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The passage does not require them to pay a fee. The correct answer is B.
Correct! Frequent guests are encouraged to become members to enjoy unlimited access.

mc_options.text: C: given priority booking for classes
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. Priority booking is only for members. The correct answer is B.

mc_options.text: D: not permitted to bring a guest
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is B (encouraged to become members).

questions.options:
A: required to pay a visitor fee
B: encouraged to become members
C: given priority booking for classes
D: not permitted to bring a guest

questions.question: 13. Swimming lessons at Brightwood Leisure Centre are held
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is C (every Saturday morning from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM for children aged 3-10).

mc_options.text: A: three times a week during weekday evenings
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The lessons are held on Saturday mornings. The correct answer is C.

mc_options.text: B: only for children aged 5-14 years old
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. Swimming lessons are for ages 3-10. The correct answer is C.

mc_options.text: C: every Saturday morning for children aged 3-10 years
mc_options.feedback: Correct! Swimming lessons are held every Saturday morning from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM for children aged 3-10.
Incorrect. Holiday camps are for school holidays; swimming lessons are regular Saturday programs. The correct answer is C.

questions.options:
A: three times a week during weekday evenings
B: only for children aged 5-14 years old
C: every Saturday morning for children aged 3-10 years
D: only during school holidays

questions.question: 14. Children attending centre activities must have
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is D (a completed medical consent form on file).

mc_options.text: A: parental supervision at all times
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The requirement is a medical consent form. The correct answer is D.

mc_options.text: B: a valid health insurance policy
mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. A medical consent form is required, not insurance. The correct answer is D.
Incorrect. The requirement is a medical consent form. The correct answer is D.

mc_options.text: D: a completed medical consent form on file
mc_options.feedback: Correct! The passage states that children must have a completed medical consent form on file with emergency contact information and relevant medical conditions.

questions.options:
A: parental supervision at all times
B: a valid health insurance policy
C: a swimming ability assessment
D: a completed medical consent form on file

questions.instructions:
Questions 15 – 20

Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Text 4?

Write TRUE, FALSE or NOT GIVEN.
questions.question: 15. You should research industry salary standards before negotiating with your manager.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is TRUE.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! The passage explicitly states to research industry standards before initiating discussions.
Incorrect. The passage clearly recommends researching salary standards. The correct answer is TRUE.
Incorrect. The passage provides information about this. The correct answer is TRUE.

questions.question: 16. You should focus on personal financial needs when presenting your case for a pay rise.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is FALSE.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The passage states to focus on value brought to the company, not personal needs. The correct answer is FALSE.
Correct! The passage clearly states to focus on value brought to the company rather than personal financial needs.
Incorrect. The passage provides this information. The correct answer is FALSE.

questions.question: 17. It is best to request a pay rise during the morning hours.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is NOT GIVEN.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The passage discusses timing (after projects, during reviews) but not time of day. The correct answer is NOT GIVEN.
Incorrect. The passage does not provide information about time of day. The correct answer is NOT GIVEN.
Correct! The passage does not mention what time of day is best for requesting a pay rise.

questions.question: 18. If your initial pay rise request is declined, you should ask about future opportunities.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is TRUE.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! The passage states to ask what improvements would make you eligible for a raise in the future.
Incorrect. The passage recommends asking about future opportunities. The correct answer is TRUE.
Incorrect. The passage provides this information. The correct answer is TRUE.

questions.question: 19. Your manager must make a decision about your pay rise request within one week.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is FALSE.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The passage mentions a two-week timeframe for follow-up, not one week. The correct answer is FALSE.
Correct! The passage suggests requesting a follow-up meeting within two weeks, not one week.
Incorrect. The passage provides timing information. The correct answer is FALSE.

questions.question: 20. Negotiation for salary increases is a standard business practice.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is TRUE.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! The passage explicitly states that negotiation is a normal business practice.
Incorrect. The passage confirms negotiation is a normal practice. The correct answer is TRUE.
Incorrect. The passage provides this information. The correct answer is TRUE.

Incorrect. This is in the Format and Structure section. The correct answer is A.

B: Content Guidelines
C: Closing Statements
D: Common Mistakes to Avoid

Incorrect. This is in Closing Statements. The correct answer is C.

questions.options:
A: Format and Structure
B: Content Guidelines

D: Common Mistakes to Avoid

questions.question: 24. Using appropriate professional formatting and margins
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is A (Format and Structure).

mc_options.feedback: Correct! Formatting and margins are covered in the Format and Structure section.
Incorrect. This is about formatting. The correct answer is A.
Incorrect. This is about formatting. The correct answer is A.
Incorrect. This is in Format and Structure. The correct answer is A.

questions.options:

D: Common Mistakes to Avoid

questions.question: 25. Not using generic letters and avoiding informal language
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is D (Common Mistakes to Avoid).

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This is about mistakes to avoid. The correct answer is D.
Incorrect. This is about mistakes to avoid. The correct answer is D.
Incorrect. This is about mistakes to avoid. The correct answer is D.
Correct! Not using generic letters and avoiding informal language are mistakes to avoid.

questions.options:

questions.question: 26. Mentioning the specific position and job listing source

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. This is about content. The correct answer is B.

questions.instructions:
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage 3?
In boxes 27 – 32 on your answer sheet, write
TRUE if the statement agrees with the information
FALSE if the statement contradicts the information
NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this
You should spend about 20 minutes on Question 27 which are based on Reading Passage 3.
questions.question: The majority of Pluto’s terrain was formed by collisions with other space bodies.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is FALSE. Paragraph F states: 'in addition to the impact of other space bodies colliding with the planet, the majority of its terrain has been shaped by a combination of ice sublimation and tectonic forces'. The majority was NOT formed by collisions. Always take a guess—there's no penalty for wrong answers in IELTS.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. Paragraph F states: 'in addition to the impact of other space bodies colliding with the planet, the majority of its terrain has been shaped by a combination of ice sublimation and tectonic forces'. The majority was NOT formed by collisions.

Correct! Paragraph F states: 'in addition to the impact of other space bodies colliding with the planet, the majority of its terrain has been shaped by a combination of ice sublimation and tectonic forces'. The majority was NOT formed by collisions.

Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. Paragraph F states: 'in addition to the impact of other space bodies colliding with the planet, the majority of its terrain has been shaped by a combination of ice sublimation and tectonic forces'. The majority was NOT formed by collisions.

questions.question: Walt Disney named the planet Pluto after one of his cartoon characters.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is NOT GIVEN. Paragraph B mentions: 'It has been rumoured that Pluto's discovery served as inspiration for Walt Disney's canine character' but does not say Disney named the planet. Always take a guess—there's no penalty for wrong answers in IELTS.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is NOT GIVEN. Paragraph B mentions: 'It has been rumoured that Pluto's discovery served as inspiration for Walt Disney's canine character' but does not say Disney named the planet.

Incorrect. The correct answer is NOT GIVEN. Paragraph B mentions: 'It has been rumoured that Pluto's discovery served as inspiration for Walt Disney's canine character' but does not say Disney named the planet.
Correct! Paragraph B mentions: 'It has been rumoured that Pluto's discovery served as inspiration for Walt Disney's canine character' but does not say Disney named the planet.

questions.question: The New Horizons space probe has travelled beyond the Solar System.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is NOT GIVEN. The passage states New Horizons flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt but does not explicitly state whether it has travelled beyond the Solar System. Always take a guess—there's no penalty for wrong answers in IELTS.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is NOT GIVEN. The passage states New Horizons flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt but does not explicitly state whether it has travelled beyond the Solar System.

Incorrect. The correct answer is NOT GIVEN. The passage states New Horizons flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt but does not explicitly state whether it has travelled beyond the Solar System.
Correct! The passage states New Horizons flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt but does not explicitly state whether it has travelled beyond the Solar System.

questions.question: Styx was discovered in 2011.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is FALSE. Paragraph C states Styx was discovered in 2012, not 2011: 'the final two of Pluto's known moons, named Kerberos and Styx, being discovered in 2011 and 2012 respectively'. Always take a guess—there's no penalty for wrong answers in IELTS.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. Paragraph C states Styx was discovered in 2012, not 2011: 'the final two of Pluto's known moons, named Kerberos and Styx, being discovered in 2011 and 2012 respectively'.
Correct! Paragraph C states Styx was discovered in 2012, not 2011: 'the final two of Pluto's known moons, named Kerberos and Styx, being discovered in 2011 and 2012 respectively'.

Incorrect. The correct answer is FALSE. Paragraph C states Styx was discovered in 2012, not 2011: 'the final two of Pluto's known moons, named Kerberos and Styx, being discovered in 2011 and 2012 respectively'.

questions.question: Pluto lies within the Kuiper belt.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is TRUE. The passage states that Pluto is located in the Kuiper belt multiple times, including in paragraph A: 'flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt'. Always take a guess—there's no penalty for wrong answers in IELTS.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! The passage states that Pluto is located in the Kuiper belt multiple times, including in paragraph A: 'flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt'.
Incorrect. The correct answer is TRUE. The passage states that Pluto is located in the Kuiper belt multiple times, including in paragraph A: 'flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt'.
Incorrect. The correct answer is TRUE. The passage states that Pluto is located in the Kuiper belt multiple times, including in paragraph A: 'flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt'.

questions.question: Eris has insufficient mass to clear its orbit of smaller objects.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is TRUE. Paragraph D explains that Eris, like Pluto, fails to clear its orbit, which is why it is not classified as a planet. Always take a guess—there's no penalty for wrong answers in IELTS.

mc_options.feedback: Correct! Paragraph D explains that Eris, like Pluto, fails to clear its orbit, which is why it is classified as a dwarf planet rather than a full planet.

Incorrect. The correct answer is TRUE. Paragraph D explains that Eris, like Pluto, fails to meet the criteria of clearing its orbit of smaller objects, which is why both are classified as dwarf planets.
Incorrect. The correct answer is TRUE. Paragraph D specifically addresses this, explaining that dwarf planets like Eris do not have sufficient mass to clear their orbits.

questions.instructions:
Reading Passage 3 has seven paragraphs, A – G.
Which paragraph contains the following information?
Write the correct letter A – G in boxes 38 – 40 on your answer sheet.
questions.question: The significance of the New Horizons mission.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is provided in the feedback. In the IELTS test, you should always attempt an answer as there's no penalty for incorrect responses.

mc_options.feedback: Incorrect. The correct answer is G. Paragraph A describes the mission and equipment, but Paragraph G discusses the significance of the mission to space exploration.
Incorrect. The correct answer is G. Paragraph B discusses Pluto's discovery and naming, not the significance of New Horizons.
Incorrect. The correct answer is G. Paragraph C discusses Pluto's moons, not the New Horizons mission's significance.
Incorrect. The correct answer is G. Paragraph D discusses Pluto's reclassification, not the New Horizons mission's significance.
Incorrect. The correct answer is G. Paragraph E discusses the IAU definition of planets, not the New Horizons mission's significance.
Incorrect. The correct answer is G. Paragraph F describes Pluto's terrain, not the significance of the New Horizons mission.
Correct! Paragraph G discusses how the mission represents 'the culmination of more than a decade's worth of preparation' and 'the beginning of a new chapter in space exploration'.

questions.options:
A
B
C
D
E
F
G

reading_texts.title: Reading Text 1
reading_texts.content:
Hidden Treasures Music Store – September Members' Newsletter

Stockists of rare and collectors' items – take a walk down Memory Lane!

Music categories

J – Jazz    B – Blues    R – Rock & Roll

New Arrivals This Month
Artist Genre Details
Under £20
Bill Benjamin J A rare chance to buy the artist's first album. 5 copies in stock.
Gerome and the Jives R 10 copies remaining. Reduced from £30.
Giles Bertram B Currently out of stock. Expected delivery 25 September.
The Rockerbillies R Digitally remastered for enhanced quality.

reading_texts.title: Reading Text 2
reading_texts.content:
Brightwood Leisure Centre – Facilities and Rules

Welcome to Brightwood Leisure Centre. To ensure all members and guests enjoy their visit safely, please observe the following rules and regulations.

Membership Categories

Full membership is available to individuals aged 16 years and above, with an annual fee of £280. This includes unlimited access to all facilities during opening hours and priority booking for classes.

Student membership is available to full-time students aged 18-25 for £120 per year. Valid student identification must be presented at registration.

Family membership covering up to four household members costs £450 annually and is ideal for families who want to exercise together.

Facility Rules

All swimmers must wear appropriate swimwear in the pool area; shorts and t-shirts are not acceptable. Swimming caps are recommended but not mandatory. Shower facilities are available before and after use of the pool.

Gym equipment must be used only as instructed by staff. Members must complete an induction session before using the weights room for the first time. Mobile phones should be set to silent mode in all facilities.

Children under 8 years old are not permitted in the gym or weights room. Children aged 8-15 may use the gym only when supervised by an adult member.

Booking and Cancellations

Classes should be booked online at least 24 hours in advance. Cancellations must be made 12 hours before the class start time to avoid a £5 cancellation fee. No-shows will be recorded, and members with more than three no-shows in a month will have their class booking privileges suspended for one week.

Safety and Conduct

Staff members reserve the right to ask members to leave if they fail to comply with rules or behave inappropriately. All accidents should be reported immediately to staff. First aid facilities are available at the front desk.

The centre operates from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM weekdays and 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM weekends.

reading_texts.title: Reading Text 3
reading_texts.content:
Guest and Children Policies at Brightwood Leisure Centre

Guest Privileges

Members can bring up to two guests per visit, though guests must be accompanied by their sponsoring member at all times. Guest passes are free and valid for one visit only.

Guests do not have access to the changing facilities without supervision and must follow all centre rules. Guests are not permitted to use the weights room or attend specialized classes.

Frequent guests who visit more than six times per year are encouraged to become members to enjoy unlimited access to all facilities.

Children's Programmes

The centre offers swimming lessons for children aged 3-10 years old, held every Saturday morning from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM. Classes are taught by qualified instructors and grouped by ability level.

Holiday camps are available during school holidays for children aged 5-14. These camps include a variety of activities such as swimming, games, sports, and craft activities. Early booking is essential as places are limited.

Children attending any centre activities must have a completed medical consent form on file. This form should include emergency contact information and any relevant medical conditions.

Additional Information

Parents and caregivers are welcome to observe swimming lessons from the viewing gallery. For enquiries about children's programs, please contact the centre directly.

reading_texts.title: Reading Text 4
reading_texts.content:
Guidelines for Negotiating a Pay Rise at Work

Many employees feel uncertain about requesting a pay increase from their employer. However, with proper preparation and a professional approach, salary negotiations can be successful.

Before You Start

Research industry salary standards for your position, experience level, and geographic location before initiating any discussion with your manager. This ensures your request is realistic and backed by data.

Document your achievements and contributions over the past year, including successful projects, additional responsibilities you have assumed, and positive feedback from colleagues or clients. This evidence strengthens your case considerably.

Choose an appropriate time to request a meeting—ideally after a successful project completion, during performance reviews, or when the company is performing well financially.

The Negotiation Meeting

Start the conversation by thanking your manager for considering your request and expressing your commitment to the organization. This sets a positive tone for the discussion.

Present your case clearly by explaining why you deserve a raise, focusing on the value you bring to the company rather than personal financial needs. Mention specific accomplishments and how you have improved efficiency or contributed to company goals.

Listen carefully to your manager's feedback. They may outline concerns, budget constraints, or offer alternative benefits such as additional vacation days or flexible working arrangements.

After the Discussion

If your manager needs time to consider, request a follow-up meeting within two weeks to discuss their decision. Agree on a specific date before the meeting concludes.

Even if your initial request is declined, ask what specific improvements or achievements would make you eligible for a raise in the future, and establish clear goals to work towards. This demonstrates your commitment to professional growth and keeps the door open for future negotiations.

Remember that negotiation is a normal business practice, and most employers expect employees to request pay increases periodically.

reading_texts.title: Reading Text 5
reading_texts.content:
Essential Rules for Writing an Effective Cover Letter

Format and Structure

A cover letter should be one page long, written on white paper with professional margins of one inch on all sides. Use a standard business font such as Arial or Times New Roman in size 11 or 12.

Include your contact information at the top of the letter, followed by the date, and then the employer's name and company address. Address the letter to a specific person whenever possible; research the hiring manager's name on the company website or LinkedIn.

Content Guidelines

The opening paragraph should mention the specific position you are applying for and where you found the job listing. This shows that you have tailored your application to this particular opportunity.

In the main body, explain why you are interested in the company and the role, highlighting how your skills and experience match the job requirements. Use specific examples from your background to demonstrate your qualifications.

Avoid repeating information that is already in your CV. Instead, add value by explaining your genuine interest in the position and what you can contribute to the organization.

Closing Statements

Conclude with a strong closing paragraph that expresses your enthusiasm for the opportunity and includes a call to action, such as requesting an interview. Thank the reader for their time and consideration.

Sign off professionally with "Sincerely" or "Best regards" followed by your full name typed below, leaving space for your handwritten signature if submitting a printed copy. Proofread carefully for spelling and grammar errors before sending.

Common Mistakes to Avoid

Do not use generic cover letters. Each letter should be customized for the specific position and company. Avoid using informal language or jokes that may not be appropriate in a professional context. Never include negative comments about previous employers.

reading_texts.title: Reading Text 6
reading_texts.content:
DWARF PLANET

The Discovery, Classification and Exploration of Pluto

A: On the 14th of July, 2015, a NASA deep space probe called New Horizons flew through the Pluto system in the Kuiper belt, located almost 6 billion kilometres from our sun, gathering high resolution photographs of the dwarf planet and its moons. Scientifically, the aims of the New Horizons mission were to provide experts on Earth with greater detail regarding the geomorphology, atmosphere, magnetosphere and surface composition of Pluto. As well as cameras for high resolution imagery, the spacecraft used an array of on-board scientific equipment to obtain information, including remote sensors, radio transmitters, computer subsystems, a large satellite dish and a radioisotope thermoelectric generator.

B: Pluto was discovered in February, 1930, by the American Charles Tombaugh, a young self-taught astronomer working at the Lowell Observatory in Arizona. Tombaugh, then in his early twenties, detected the existence of the planet by examining anomalies in photographic plates with the aid of a special viewing apparatus known as a blink microscope. His discovery soon made worldwide news headlines, and on the 25th of May, 1930, the members of the Lowell Observatory chose the name of Pluto for the ninth planet in the Solar System by unanimous vote. The name itself comes from that of the Roman god of the underworld, and was suggested by a schoolgirl living in England, whose uncle, a retired university librarian, had passed on her suggestion through academic acquaintances. It has been rumoured that Pluto's discovery served as inspiration for Walt Disney's canine character of the same name. There is, however, no question surrounding the naming of the element plutonium, which was named after the planet following the creation of the former by a team of scientists at the University of California in the early 1940s.

C: The estimated mass of Pluto was steadily revised downwards in the decades following its discovery, and was not accurately calculated until 1978, the same year in which Charon, the largest of the planet's five moons, was discovered by the United States Naval Observatory astronomer James Christy. While the original estimate of Pluto's mass had been seven times that of Earth, Christy and his colleague, Robert Harrington, compared Charon's orbital period and size with those of Pluto, estimating the planet's mass to be approximately 0.2 per cent that of the earth. A pair of smaller satellites, Nix and Hydra, was subsequently identified in 2005, with the final two of Pluto's known moons, named Kerberos and Styx, being discovered in 2011 and 2012 respectively.

D: However, in spite of having been regarded as the ninth planet in the solar system for more than fifty years, Pluto's status and classification began to come into question towards the close of the twentieth century. Initially, this was due to the fact that during the nineties a number of objects, made of rock and ice and of a similar size to Pluto, were discovered lying within the Kuiper belt, a circumstellar disc, in many ways resembling a gigantic asteroid belt, at the edge of the Solar System beyond Neptune. The first of these new Kuiper Belt Objects (KBOs) was identified in 1992 by a pair of astronomers, David Jewitt and Jane Luu, working out of the Mauna Kea Observatory in Hawaii. Many more Kuiper Belt Objects were found in the years that followed, making Pluto's official status as a planet increasingly controversial among many in the scientific community. While Pluto remains, at present, the largest of the known trans-Neptunian objects located in the Kuiper belt, the discovery in 2005 of a minor planet with a greater mass, Eris, in an outlying region of the Kuiper belt known as the scattered disc, prompted the International Astronomical Union (IAU) to create a formal definition of the term "planet" that excluded Pluto.

E: When the New Horizons interplanetary space probe was launched from Cape Canaveral in January, 2006, its primary mission was to voyage to Pluto, at that time the only remaining unexplored planet in the Solar System. However, in August of the same year, at the General Assembly of the International Astronomical Union (IAU) held in the Czech Republic, Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet on account of the fact that it did not meet one of the three formal conditions required to be classed as a planet. According to the official definition of the IAU, a planet must be in orbit around the sun and have sufficient mass both for its own gravity to make it spherical in shape and estion="30">to have cleared the area around its orbit of smaller objects. Failing to meet the third of these criteria, Pluto was classified as a "dwarf planet". While the decision of the IAU to reduce the number of planets in the Solar System from nine to eight has received its fair share of both praise and criticism, the definition of Pluto as a dwarf planet, while controversial, remains in use. Today, there are five known bodies in the Solar System that have been recognised by the IAU as dwarf planets. In addition to Pluto, these are Ceres, Haumea, Makemake and Eris. At the same time, it has been estimated that there may be hundreds more as yet undiscovered and unclassified dwarf planets throughout the Solar System.

F: The high resolution images of Pluto made during the New Horizons close flyby of the planet and beamed back to Earth from across the Solar System have revealed a unique terrain. Far from being a flat, dead world, the rocky dwarf planet's surface contains a multitude of varied, complex landscapes, ranging from oddly-textured ridges with the appearance of tree bark or dragon scales, ice cliffs, valleys and mountains and frozen lakes and oceans to heavily cratered and pitted plains. Experts theorise that, in addition to the impact of other space bodies colliding with the planet, the majority of its terrain has been shaped by a combination of ice sublimation and tectonic forces. While still awaiting official approval from the International Astronomical Union, names for a number of Pluto's regions and topographical features have already been proposed by the New Horizons discovery team in consultation with the general public, including Tombaugh Regio, the Brass Knuckles, Tartarus Dorsa and Cthulhu Regio, the latter named after a fictional deity from the works of American author H.P. Lovecraft.

G: Irrespective of its official present classification as a dwarf planet, the New Horizons reconnaissance of Pluto provides a wealth of knowledge and data regarding the last major body in the Solar System not previously visited by a space probe. While the planet, spacecraft and New Horizons team may be comparatively small, the mission to the Pluto system not only represents the culmination of more than a decade's worth of preparation on Earth, but also the beginning of a new chapter in space exploration at the edge of the Solar System and beyond.
